intro: Argostemma taiwanense, commonly known as the Taiwan argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
